document_data.name: ''Bloodbone Throne of Uruth''
document_data.refs3e: {{Cite dragon/351/Volo's Guide: Lost Regalia of the North: The Toppled Thrones}}
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Bloodbone Throne of Uruth''''' served as the throne for three of the [[orc|orcish]] kings of the realm of [[Uruth Ukrypt]] until it was stolen.
document_data.Description: The throne was made from the fused bones of the orc-king's defeated enemies, particularly the defenders of [[Uthtower]] and [[Phalorm]], and a great [[crag cat]]. The seat itself was made from the ribcage of the crag cat and the back was a triangular stack of skulls, each with a single eye of [[Gruumsh]]. The stairs leading up to the throne were believed to be made from the skulls of six Phalorm princes. Overall the throne had a diameter of over {{SI|12|ft|long=yes}} and a height of {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}}.
document_data.Powers: When someone sat upon the throne, they could call upon its various powers. Among them were the ability to shroud the throne in unholy darkness, [[command]] nearby creatures, spew a cloud of greasy darkness, and cloak themselves in a [[dragon]]-shaped shroud of bones. Perhaps the most powerful ability of the throne, and the one that gave its name, was the ability to summon forth a "[[blood elemental]]" of varying degrees in size. The elemental was essentially a [[water elemental]] whose touch could cause one's blood to boil.
document_data.History:
Fashioned for the first king of [[Uruth Ukrypt]], the ''Bloodbone Throne'' went on to serve two additional orcish kings in the [[Sword Mountains]]. During the [[Rage of Dragons]], the realm was attacked by the [[black dragon]] [[Shammagar]] and the [[green dragon]] [[Claugiyliamatar]]. Shammagar seized the orcs' capital at [[Melairrin]] as his new lair, and the throne was among the treasures he claimed.{{Cite web enhancement/Environs of Waterdeep|14}}

When a [[rogue]] named [[Asilther Graelor]] plundered Shammagar's hoard over three centuries later, she took possession of the throne for a short time. It was soon lost in transit on its way to [[Herald's Holdfast]] during an ambush near the town of [[Nesm√©]]. Where it went from there is not definitively known. Rumors spread that it may have been in the western reaches of the [[High Forest]], where it was being used by an antlered orc king.
